DataElement.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Chewing 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of their ability to chew in the past seven days, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Chewing
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._A question about a person's most important health issues._The most recent week, including today._Biting and grinding food in your mouth so that you can swallow it.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard of three responses from chew as well as ever to cannot chew.

PermissibleValues.value: I cannot even chew soft solids.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot chew soft solid foods.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot chew soft solid foods.

PermissibleValues.value: I can eat soft solids but cannot chew some foods.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual can eat soft solids but cannot chew some foods.

PermissibleValues.value: I can chew as well as ever.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Can Chew as Well as Ever

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Can Chew as Well as Ever
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual can chew as well as ever.
